#summary Howto install TheLastRipper under Linux
#labels Help,Linux
_There's two ways of installing TheLastRipper depending on you distro, if your distro is Debian based the first one is recommended._

===Installation under Ubuntu/Debian===
_Follow these instructions if your distro is based of Debian or Ubuntu._

   # Download the latest deb package from our downloads listing.
   # Right click it and choose "install" or "open with gdebi"

You can also install it with following commands:
{{{
$ wget http://thelastripper.googlecode.com/files/thelastripper_1.0.1-1_all.deb
$ sudo dpkg -i thelastripper_1.0.1-1_all.deb
}}}

===Installation from source===
_Follow these instructions if you cannot install deb packages under your distribution of choice_

*Note:* This installation method does NOT install man pages, desktop files (or any other menu entry for that matter), the only method to launch the application after install is by command: thelastripper.

   # Install requirements through the package manager of you distro:
    * xdg-utils (optional)
    * mono-runtime
    * libglib2.0-cli
    * libgtk2.0-cli
    * libmono-corlib2.0-cli
    * libmono-system2.0-cli
    * If more's needed the configure script will complain.
   # Download the latest tarball from out downloads listing.
   # Extract the content of the tarball
   # Run the `./configure` script
   # Build the application with `make`
   # Install the application with `make install`
   # Launch the application with following command: `thelastripper`
